Documentation_Link.Text:
Variable Description Plot Plot number at NDFF (1-9) Location aspect from center (c) where soil sample was taken Depth (cm) soil depth sample was obtained Sample wt (g) total weight of sample Rock wt(g) weight of sample retained by 2 mm sieve Soil wt (g) weight of sample passed through 2 mm sieve Rock % % of sample retained by 2 mm sieve Soil % % of sample passed through 2 mm sieve
Method: Samples collected in 1997 from center of each plot before CO2 treatment commenced. Samples were oven dried (60C) and total weight determined. Sample were fractionated using a 2mm sieve and weights of rock fraction ( = 2mm) and soil fraction ( 2mm) determined. Soil fraction was further analyzed for particle size ([NDFF_Soil_Particle_Size.xls]).
Contributed by: S.Zitzer

Variable Description Ring Plot number at NDFF (1-9) Depth soil depth sample was obtained %Sieve % of sample retained by 62.5 um sieve %Finer % of sample passed through 62.5 um sieve. Fraction used for lazer Digisizer analysis. % 62.5um Sand fraction of sample, %Sieve + fraction determined to be 62.5 um by lazer Digisizer. %15um Coarse Silt fraction determined to be between 62.5um and 15 um by lazer Digisizer. %3um Fine Silt fraction determined to be between 15um and 3um by lazer Digisizer. % 3um Clay fraction determined to be less than 3um by lazer Digisizer.
Methods: Soil fractions of samples collected at NDFF([NDFF_Soil_Texture.xls]) in 1997 before CO2 treatment commenced. Samples were processed through 62.5 um sieve to remove sand fraction then analysized for fine soil particle size on Micromeretics Saturn DigiSizer 5200.(see http://soilslab.dri.edu/instrument_dig.htm) Contributed by: S.Zitzer
